column1: Even Dr. Fauci agrees: Vitamin D is a way to reduce susceptibility to disease and infection. This should be part of our national strategy to curb the effects and spread of COVID 19. https://t.co/Ic3GcVIYYs

Recent study found that Vitamin D deficiency increases the likelihood of testing positive for COVID-19 by 77%. I will continue to pressure the CDC to look into the relationship between Vitamin D & COVID because breakthroughs get us closer to defeating it. https://t.co/FZX71aJghZ

More studies continue to show the correlation between an increased risk of COVID-19 and low levels of Vitamin D. Ensuring your Vitamin D levels are healthy is an easy step to help make our communities safer and keep our hospitalizations down. https://t.co/hasTFG879g

It was a pleasure joining WISC 1130 to discuss what we're working on in Congress COVID-19 relief & the unrest happening across the country. It's always been my mission to stand for Sixth District families expand the economy & support law enforcement. https://t.co/X8lYcUhWFo

Battling an invisible enemy like the Coronavirus will take a multi-faceted approach. It's encouraging to see important research going into drugs and remedies that will weaken the severity and mortality rates of COVID-19. https://t.co/u0J4tOGdHK

According to studies out of Northwestern University & Trinity College Vitamin-D deficiency plays a role in the severity & mortality rates associated with COVID-19. Did you know WI's 6th District produces many of the Vitamin-D rich products that Americans can take advantage of? https://t.co/siApCU6dh5

Thrilled VP @Mike_Pence is in the 6th district today. He’s joining us in Ripon the birthplace of the @GOP to talk about the work the Trump Administration is doing to protect Wisconsin jobs & combat the Coronavirus pandemic. I look forward to seeing him! https://t.co/GiGEGXMLfx

There's a correlation between Vitamin D deficiency & COVID-19 mortality rates. My amendment to the HEROES Act which would have required the CDC to research this was shot down by House Dems. I will continue to call on the CDC to study this further. https://t.co/BkY63qHQ1t

Early research has illustrated a clear correlation between vitamin D deficiencies and higher COVID-19 mortality rates. As such I will continue to encourage the CDC to look into vitamin D’s impact on the virus. https://t.co/r19pO1R4Wo

It's #NationalEMSWeek & I hope you will join me in saying thank you to all our emergency medical workers in Wisconsin & across our nation. Along with nurses and doctors EMS workers play a critical role in our healthcare system & have been on the front lines fighting #COVID19. https://t.co/bNbtmbEVi7

While we combat COVID-19 we cannot neglect patients who need things like heart stents heart valves and diagnostic testing. We need to get our hospitals reopened safely in Wisconsin. What is being considered "non-essential" in many cases is life-saving. https://t.co/Kcp5SvYdzk

Yesterday I joined @JayWeber3 to talk about COVID-19 and the importance of reopening Wisconsin hospitals and medical facilities to elective surgeries and other non-essential procedures. Our interview starts at 58:40. Listen now at the link below: https://t.co/ZL2HQcUToM

Help is on the way for our small businesses & workers in Wisconsin. The SBA Paycheck Protection Program will help businesses struggling during COVID-19 by providing loans for payroll rent mortgage interest and utilities. Learn more at the link below. https://t.co/fh4MbfNfAI

While we combat #COVIDー19 it is important we do everything we can to support our small businesses in Wisconsin. I am pleased to report that @SBAgov is offering disaster loans for our businesses with more information available at https://t.co/AHpikOPKPK. https://t.co/8JTjBMW3zp
